titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Page Smith Papers LSC.0620
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by UCLA Library University Archives staff; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cub√©.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-24 15:26:35 -0700.

did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Unprocessed collection. Material is unavailable for access. Please contact Special Collections reference (spec-coll@library.ucla.edu) for more information.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Page Smith Papers (Collection 620). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

acqinfo.head: Provenance/Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Page Smith Papers were acquired in 2004 from the Page Smith family and in cooperation with the Special Collections and Archives of the Library, University of California, Santa Cruz.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by UCLA Library University Archives staff.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

odd.head: UCLA Catalog Record ID
odd.p: UCLA Catalog Record ID: 9964152053606533

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Historian (Charles) Page Smith was born on Septermber 16, 1917 in Baltimore, Maryland; B.A. Dartmouth College (1940); Ph.D. Harvard University (1951) under the direction of Samuel Eliot Morison. Assistant professor of history at the University of California, Los Angeles (1952); associate professor (1956); professor (1963). In 1964 Smith left UCLA to become the founding Provost of Cowell College, University of California, Santa Cruz and resigned from the university in 1973. In 1963 he won the Bancroft Prize for his 1962 biography of John Adams. Smith died on August 28, 1995 in Santa Cruz, California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes: unpublished papers, manuscript drafts, reprints, book reviews, research notes, notes for courses, scripts for talks given by Page Smith, subject files, correspondence, biographical materials, professional association and conference materials, newspaper articles by Page Smith.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: articles (newspaper, newsletter, journal) and tributes to Page Smith.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily photocopies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Interview scripts including radio interviews.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily photocopies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, notes, programs for talks, and short papers by various authors about the life and influence of Rosenstock-Huessy.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Historian and social philosopher Eugene Rosenstock-Huessy (b.1888-d.1973) taught at Dartmouth College while Page Smith was an undergraduate student at Dartmouth. One of Page Smith's early mentors, he exerted a significant influence over Page Smith's thought and work.

did.unittitle: Southampton Summer Conference: Project Open. [Westport, Connecticut]
Talks by Page Smith -- notes, scripts, and programs.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Full title: "A new age now begins: A people's history of the United States." Published in 1976 as a two-volume set. Six more volumes, 3-8, of "A People's History of the United States," each dealing with a different historical era, were published between 1980-1986.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: "Coming of Age" was a weekly column on aging written by Page Smith from August 1988 until March 1992 for Chronicle Features. The syndicated column was published in many papers including the San Francisco Chronicle. It was also published under the title, "Time to live."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes: memoir text (typed from W. Ward Smith dictation), photographs, and publication materials relating to "A letter from my father: the strange, intimate correspondence of W. Ward Smith to his son Page Smith," edited by Page Smith (Morrow, 1976). W. Ward Smith (b.1893-d.1968) was the father of Page Smith.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs (46 items) numbered in red pencil and used in the publication, "A letter from my father: The strange, intimate correspondence of W. Ward Smith to his son Page Smith," edited by Page Smith. Includes: images of W. Ward Smith as a child; W. Ward Smith's family; Page Smith; W. Ward Smith's wives and other women in his life; W. Ward Smith's travels; images of New York politicians and businessmen.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: See flat oversized folder on bottom of box.

did.unittitle: "A letter from my father..." page proofs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two sets of page proofs in page number order. One set in 16 printed (blue print) booklets approximately 31 pages each. Also includes cardboard templates with design layout of front matter (title page, table of contents, and copyright page).

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Full title: "A letter from my father: The strange, intimate correspondence of W. Ward Smith to his son Page Smith" edited by Page Smith.

did.unittitle: "A letter from my father..." typed transcriptions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: W. Ward Smith's memoir repaginated in red pencil with editorial marks and inserted typed explanatory pages by Page Smith. The bulk of the transcriptions covers the years 1920-1930. Includes (repaginated) manuscript pages 1-599. Transcriptions in approximate chronological order by page number; some gaps in pagination. See boxes #2 and 3 for remainder of memoir.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Portions of W. Ward Smith's memoir were used for the publication, "A letter from my father: The strange, intimate correspondence of W. Ward Smith to his son Page Smith," edited by Page Smith.

did.unittitle: "A letter from my father..." galley proofs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two sets of galley proofs, one marked "Reader's Set" the other marked "AU's gals." Contain typed and hand-written edits.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Full title: "A letter from my father: The strange, intimate correspondence of W. Ward Smith to his son Page Smith" edited by Page Smith.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Page two and three of typed letter written by W. Ward Smith describing travels in China and the Philippines.

did.unittitle: "A letter from my father..." typed transcriptions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: W. Ward Smith's memoir repaginated in red pencil with editorial marks and inserted typed explanatory pages by Page Smith. The bulk of the transcriptions covers the years 1930-1942. Includes photocopies of transcribed correspondence between W. Ward Smith and Page Smith covering the period from 1933 April-July. Includes (repaginated) manuscript pages 600-1383. Transcriptions in approximate chronological order by page number; some gaps in pagination. See boxes #1 and 3 for remainder of memoir.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Portions of W. Ward Smith's memoir were used for the publication, "A letter from my father: The strange, intimate correspondence of W. Ward Smith to his son Page Smith," edited by Page Smith.

did.unittitle: "A letter from my father..." typed transcriptions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Five unpaginated pages of W. Ward Smith's memoir. Includes two pages of a transcribed letter by W. Ward Smith to Page Smith dated October 1929.

did.unittitle: "A letter from my father..." typed transcriptions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: W. Ward Smith's memoir with original pagination. While the bulk of the transcriptions covers the years 1926-1941, the text begins with W. Ward Smith's boyhood (1890s). Includes W. Ward Smith's travels with second wife, Melba, to Japan, China, India, and Egypt. Contains a transcription of W. Ward Smith's resume (age 38), pages 7736-7747. Includes manuscript pages 61-7999. Transcriptions in approximate chronological order by page number; some gaps in pagination. See boxes #1 and 3 for remainder of memoir.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Portions of W. Ward Smith's memoir were used for the publication, "A letter from my father: The strange, intimate correspondence of W. Ward Smith to his son Page Smith," edited by Page Smith.

did.unittitle: "A letter from my father..." typed transcriptions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: W. Ward Smith's memoir with original pagination. The bulk of the transcriptions covers the years 1937-1943. Includes manuscript pages 8000-9815. Transcriptions in approximate chronological order by page number; some gaps in pagination. See boxes #1 and 2 for remainder of memoir.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Portions of W. Ward Smith's memoir were used for the publication, "A letter from my father: The strange, intimate correspondence of W. Ward Smith to his son Page Smith," edited by Page Smith.
